summary: Enable the ESLint `import/no-deprecated` rule to catch usage of deprecated APIs. The rule was added but commented out due to many RxJS deprecation warnings. After dependency pruning, determine if it's now feasible to enable.
userImpact: Enabling this rule would help developers catch usage of deprecated APIs earlier and encourage proactive upgrades to avoid future breaking changes.
rootCause: RxJS deprecations (scheduler parameter, resultSelector, thisArg, subscribe-arguments) were causing numerous import/no-deprecated lint errors when the rule was enabled.
proposedFix: After pruning dependencies in #1330, re-evaluate whether enabling import/no-deprecated is feasible. Determine if false-positives remain beyond what the deprecation/deprecation rule already provides.
resolutionDetails: Attempted enabling import/no-deprecated but found it caused too many false-positives with no additional benefit over the existing deprecation/deprecation rule.
keyQuote: Also tried enabling import/no-deprecated, but it caused a lot of false-positives, with nothing pertinent over what deprecation/deprecation already provides.
